title: (x) Starbucks shop front type - custom (similar to Freight Sans) {Rainer}
content:
Hey guys

Could you tell me which font Starbucks uses for its logo and written statements?

[http://wvs.topleftpixel.com/photos/2006/05/starbucks\_sale\_feet.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212/http:/wvs.topleftpixel.com/photos/2006/05/starbucks_sale_feet.jpg "http://wvs.topleftpixel.com/photos/2006/05/starbucks\_sale\_feet.jpg")

In a different topic one font for a stabucks summer promotion was identified as being Ketchupa - however, this is not the font of choice for their logo.

Thanks a lot,  
jan
author: AtomicGarden

comments.content: Looks like [terranrich](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=28091) is right with [Freight Sans Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-sans/black/).

How can that crusty afford to drink Starbucks coffee?

Nick Cooke

He sold his shoes to pay for it Nick :-)

ChrisL

The Starbucks logo was created many years before Freight was even a twinkle in Joshua Darden's eye. [Freight Sans Black is quite similar](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=GF.118889.0.17&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=STARBUCKS&sampleSize=48), but the Starbucks ID is custom lettering, not a font. Note the differences in the 'B' and 'S'.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212im_/http:/typophile.com/files/get_Font_Image_4891.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212im_/http:/typophile.com/files/600px-Starbucks_Coffee_Logo_5171.svg.png)
I always saw hints of Cosmos in the Starbucks logo.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Starbucks3_t_3558.jpg)
  
"Ören Bayan" (Knitting Woman), an old thread brand in Turkey.

The original logo: [http://5nk.org/system/files/u1/orenbayan.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150224191212/http:/5nk.org/system/files/u1/orenbayan.gif "http://5nk.org/system/files/u1/orenbayan.gif")
Syntax Ultra Black is also close.
ChrisL - that just made my day
